TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 294
TEI.2.document_title: Philip Dimmitt to Stephen F Austin, 11-30-1829

barker_notes.barker_summary: Philip Dimmitt to Austin, San Antonio, November 30, 1829. All the inhabitants of Bexar support Austin's stand on the rights of his colonists in the matter of slavery. (Omitted.)
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 294

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Philip Dimmitt to Austin, San Antonio, November 30, 1829. All the inhabitants of Bexar support Austin's stand on the rights of his colonists in the matter of slavery. (Omitted.)*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Antonio,*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="11-30-1829">November 30, 1829*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*See Calendar.*/p*
*/div1*
